channel.title: Posts on Enrique Saez
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Enrique Saez

item.title: Contributing to Donate Bitcoin
item.description: During the Hacktoberfest Barcelona event I started working on contributing to the Donate Bitcoin project.

item.title: Contributing to MadBike Android app
item.description: Hacktoberfest is a month-long celebration of open source in which people are encouraged to contribute to open source projects in GitHub.

item.title: Unit-testing pitfalls & pytest basic features
item.description: Lately, I have been answering some questions in StackOverflow related to Unit Testing in Python with Mock and pytest. These are some of the questions I answered:

item.title: Python lists: pop vs slice performance
item.description:
Recently I had a comment in a merge request in which I was suggested to copy the Nth-1 last elements of a list, a[1:], instead of popping its first element, pop(0).

I was curious about its performance implications and decided to do some simple tests:

item.title: LaTeX and moderncv in macOS
item.description: Confronted with the task of writing a CV for the first time many students resort to Microsoft Word and sloppy templates to be found on the Internet.

item.title: Test-driven information system services
item.description: Working for the backend service at Skyscanner Hotels I take part in the development of new services and its associated APIs quite regularly.

item.title: Scheduling logrotate in CentOS
item.description: Logs are a fundamental piece of the web server architecture for debugging, monitoring and alerting purposes.

item.title: Reasons for a blog
item.description: I have been enjoying the Talk Python Podcast for a while and at least two episodes revolve around the importance of having a blog as a software developer.

item.title: 2016 review
item.description: 2016 is coming to an end and I would like to look back and review what I have been up to during the last year:

item.title: Madrid Python Meetup - November'16
item.description: Last November I attended the Madrid Python Meetup. Being a regular attendant of Barcelona Python Meetup I was curious about the Python community in Madrid.

item.title: Talk: Python Best Practices
item.description: Over the last year I have attended the Barcelona Python meetup hosted at Skyscanner’s office. The meetups were a really positive experience and being a super welcoming community I decided to deliver a talk.

item.title: Contributing to Pretix
item.description: Recently I had the chance to contribute to Pretix (https://pretix.eu/about/en/) a Django-based event ticketing platform.

item.title: Contributing to aiohttp
item.description: Recently I had the opportunity to contribute to the aiohttp library. This is one of the libraries that we, the Hotels backend team at Skyscanner, make use of on a daily basis to create a new backend service.

item.title: Summer schools: an enriching experience
item.description: During my studies in Denmark I attended two Summer Universities: Aalborg University Summer School and DTU International Summer University.
